text:
Hello <@U04H7D0C6PP>

You can use the following code into the blogpost page. It can help you.

{% module "content"
      path="@HubSpot/rich_text",
      html="<p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipiscing elit tortor eu egestas morbi sem vulputate etiam facilisis pellentesque.</p>"
    %}

Hello <@U022GV1QNVB>

You can add CSS into the theme-overrides.css file. Below give you style.

/* Animation CSS */
body {overflow-x: hidden;}

/* Disable animations in page editor */
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos^="fade"][data-aos^="fade"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos^="flip"][data-aos^="flip"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos^="zoom"][data-aos^="zoom"]{
	visibility: visible!important;
   opacity: 1 !important;
}

body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="fade-up"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="fade-down"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="fade-right"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="fade-left"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="fade-up-right"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="fade-up-left"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="fade-down-right"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="fade-down-left"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="flip-left"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="flip-right"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="flip-up"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="flip-down"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="zoom-in"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="zoom-in-up"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="zoom-in-down"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="zoom-in-left"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="zoom-in-right"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="zoom-out"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="zoom-out-up"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="zoom-out-down"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="zoom-out-right"],
body.HubSpot-disable-focus-styles [data-aos="zoom-out-left"]{
  transform: initial !important;
}
Wow thank you guys for the solutions
anyone have a json validation regex for module text fields they’d like to share?
:cricket: :cricket: forget this silence lol. ChatGPT will always give me an answer – and sometimes it will be correct
I saw the message, and thought that you would make fun of the code if I tried to write it
lol nope i never make fun of code because life has a funny way paying me back for that
you would make fun of my code trust me, I make fun of my code
I’m on a mission to get <https://regex101.com/r/tA9pM8/1|this PCRE regex> to work in HubSpot’s json. trying to convert to ECMAscript and then escape for json
chatgpt is not helping either dadgumit

Anyone using VSCode w/ HubSpot extension get an error similar to `Cannot find method module_container with 4 parameters in class com.HubSpot.jinjava.objects.collections.SizeLimitingPyMap` when importing a macro into a module that includes a `{{ caller() }}`?  The HubSpot design manager doesn’t recognize it as an error and my code works as expected. But by golly is it annoying to always have my file names in error red.
